Package gg.sep.alyx.plugin.events

Class EventWaiter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gg.sep.alyx.plugin.events.EventWaiter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.dv8tion.jda.api.hooks.EventListener
    public class EventWaiter
extends java.lang.Object
implements net.dv8tion.jda.api.hooks.EventListener
    The EventWaiter class provides an asynchronous method to wait for certain Discord events to fire which meet a certain condition.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      EventWaiter​(java.lang.String identifier)
      Constructs a new instances of an Event Waiter.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void onEvent​(net.dv8tion.jda.api.events.GenericEvent event)
      Triggers on all Discord events that the bot receives in order to determine if the event matches any events waiting.
      java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> shutdown​(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Tells the EventWaiter to reject new tasks and wait for all running tasks to finish, up to the timeout specified in timeout/unit.
      <T extends net.dv8tion.jda.api.events.GenericEvent,​R>
      java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<R>      		 waitForEvent​(java.lang.Class<T> clazz, java.util.function.Predicate<T> condition, java.util.function.Function<T,​R> completedCallback, java.time.Duration timeout)
      Wait for a Discord event of type T to fire which matches the given predicate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventWaiter

        public EventWaiter​(java.lang.String identifier)
        Constructs a new instances of an Event Waiter.
        Parameters:
        identifier - Identifier used to name the threads spawned by this Event Waiter. A good practices is to use the Bot's name.

    • Method Detail

      • waitForEvent

        public <T extends net.dv8tion.jda.api.events.GenericEvent,​R> java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<R> waitForEvent​(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                                                                                          java.util.function.Predicate<T> condition,
                                                                                                                          java.util.function.Function<T,​R> completedCallback,
                                                                                                                          java.time.Duration timeout)
        Wait for a Discord event of type T to fire which matches the given predicate. If the predicate is successful, callback is triggered in order to return the result. If the timeout was reached without the event being fired, the contents of the result will be null. Your calling function will need to handle this case appropriately.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the Discord event.
        R - The type of result that is returned once the callback is applied to the event.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the Discord event, extending from GenericEvent.
        condition - The condition to check against the event in order to determine if the event completed.
        completedCallback - Callback to execute on the event once the wait is completed.
        timeout - Maximum duration to wait for the event to be completed.
        Returns:
        Asynchronous future containing the result of the callback applied to the event.

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent​(net.dv8tion.jda.api.events.GenericEvent event)
        Triggers on all Discord events that the bot receives in order to determine if the event matches any events waiting.
        Specified by:
        onEvent in interface net.dv8tion.jda.api.hooks.EventListener
        Parameters:
        event - Discord event.

      • shutdown

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> shutdown​(long timeout,
                                                                          java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Tells the EventWaiter to reject new tasks and wait for all running tasks to finish, up to the timeout specified in timeout/unit.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum time to wait
        unit - The time unit of the timeout argument
        Returns:
        true if this executor terminated successfully and false if the timeout elapsed before termination
